intro: Triptilion diffusum, commonly known as the broad-leaved triptilium, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Tripterygiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Triptilion diffusum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
